flawed_nl_solution:
The square flags use 16 square feet of fabric per flag because 4 times 4 equals <<4*4=16>>16
The wide flags each use 15 feet of fabric per flag because 5 times 3 equals <<5*3=15>>15
The tall flags each use 15 feet of fabric per flag because 5 times 3 equals <<5*3=15>>15
He has used 256 square feet for the square flags because 16 times 16 equals <<16*16=256>>256
He has used 300 square feet for the wide flags because 20 times 15 equals <<20*15=300>>300
He has used 105 square feet for the tall flags because 10 times 15 equals 105.
He has used 661 square feet because 256 plus 300 plus 105 equals <<256+300+105=661>>661.
He has 339 square feet left because 1000 minus 661 equals <<1000-661=339>>339
#### 339

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 150, not 105. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
